answers.author: Robert Woods
answers.text:
The City of Albany, Oregon has no policies that addresses the issue either way. We do maintain a roster of employees who can serve as translators for several languages when needed. Our web ste has a Google Translate option that allows folks to translate web pages. However, PDF documents do not  translate. Google has a link to a application that apparently can translate PDF documents, but I don't know we have tried it yet.
A couple of years ago we did a citizen survey and offered a spanish option, and had 1 request.

author: Monica Gutierrez
text: I'm working on a community engagement project with another city reagrding outreach & engegement of our pre-dominant minority populations.  My specific question is, "Does your city have policies supporting the translation of material into other languages (i.e. utility bill info, council packets(agendas), brochures, marketing pieces and/or translation services?  If so, please send.  I recently read an article that a City on the East Coast adopted an English Only policy.
title: Community Engagement of Minority Populations
